title: An unhealthy obsession!
body:
(i know what your thinking, but please just read to the end.)

This game has an unhealthy obsession with the Pro scene, and it negatively impacts the game. 

Firstly, 99% of the player base is amateur, and 1% is Pro (probably less) so it seems counter productive to base champion balance around the 1%
The pro's should have to make do with our balance changes, not the other way around. They basically play a different game to us regarding how they actually play, so lets not have champion balances for them and how they play, lets have them for the 99% of people.

Second and most important, its because everyone is obsessed with the pro's and pro youtubers that we get the monotonous repeats of the same few champions in every game, Lee Sin, Zed, Yasuo, Thresh, Vayne etc. etc. for gods sake just make your own decisions and play your own goddamn champions. Just because someone else did well with Zed on youtube doesn't mean that Zed is the ONLY champ you can ever do well with...
Plus do you really want to play the same champ as everyone else and use the same masteries and same strategies as everyone else?? where the fun in that? and just because a single Korean played Crit Maokai or something once doesn't mean you need to devote you life to making AD Crit maoki a thing...

Thirdly, and this one doesn't bother me too much, (i don't understand why its necessary.. but i still don't really mind it) but i know a lot of people who do. The in-game chat quality has so little intelligence because of the pro scene, someone gets a kill with zed and everyone on the team yells "FAKER!!!!!! NEW FAKER INBOUND" whenever a thresh lands a hook (which lets be honest is a pretty fucking basic thing to do, and is staple to playing that champion) everyone yells "MADLIFE!! OH YEA!! WOOOOOO"
seriously... why?
While playing rugby, if you get a try you don't suddenly stop and scream "WOOOOOOO RICHIE M'CAW!!! WOOOOO OH YEA!!" or get a penalty kick and go 
"DAN FUCKING CARTER PEOPLE! WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO"
Likewise with sailing, if you stood up on your boat whenever you passed a buoy and screamed "WOOOO GOD CAPTAIN COOK!!! WOOOOOOOOOO"
not only would you look like an idiot, but you would actually BE an idiot.
So how come the rules of being an idiot change when you're on lol? 
I'm not saying you shouldn't scream out your favourite pro's name (although why you would is beyond me) I'm just saying have a think about what you're actually screaming about, so the thresh landed a hook, great! but its not your 100th birthday or anything. Maybe if your Zed did a 1v5 penta and got away really trickily then maybe yelling something would be appropriate, but when a 21/3 Zed ults a 0/12 Nami, yelling "FAKER WOOOOOOO" is just stupid.

lastly, everyone uses it as justification for EVERYTHING:
"Im pretty good with Yasuo occasionally" 'DUDE EVEN FAKER HASNT MASTERED YASUO, WTF ARE YOU SAYING!'
"Please don't go Zed supp, it doesn't help us." 'DW MAN I SEEN IT ON YOUTUBE! IT WORKS!'
"Garen is OP, a tank doesn't need a silence and a 1500+ true damage execute!" 'GAREN IS WEAK, THE PRO'S DONT PICK HIM AT ALL WTF ARE YOU ON ABOUT?'

Seriously just live your own lives the way you want, don't think the the Pro's are gods and you need to do every single tiny little thing that they do...

Remember you will never be able to overtake someone if you can only walk in their footsteps. Think of all the great people in the world, Musicians, Actors, Scientists, Astronaughts, Athletes; David Bowie, Johnny Depp, David Attenborough, Neil Armstrong, Kobe Bryant. Whats the thing they all have in common? They did things differently, they didn't mindlessly follow someone else, they found what they as individuals were good at and pursued it, and thats what made them successful.

Choosing lee because you can follow someone else's 'Q-Q-Flash-Kick' is meaningless, Why not master your own champion and put your own combo on the map! 

Do you think your friends will be more impressed that you can follow one of Fakers moves, or that you made your own devastating combo for a champ they didn't even know was powerful.

Johnny Depp didn't become famous by playing roles that everyone else does already, he became famous because he said 'no ill do it my way' and did it.

Dont aim to be the 2nd world champion Zed or the 3rd world champion Thresh, aim to be the FIRST Urgot or Zyra World Champion.

Dont be a sheep.


{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

replies.body:
Problem here is that you say the game is balanced around the pros when it's not.

The game is balanced around Diamond and Challenger.

It is true that at a certain time of the year there will be roughly two patches that balance the game around the pros and this is in the weeks leading up to Worlds, by the time Worlds actually starts the rest of the world is two patches deep changing things back to the way they were, and getting ready to change somethings based on what happens at Worlds.

NEVER should a game be balanced around the lowest to mid tier demographic, it should always be mid tier to high tier.

Take a current look at that state of TF2, Valve has no idea how to balance.
Ever since the release of a weapon called the Phlogistinator for the Pyro the community has been crying for it to be nerfed.
At release this weapon has a MMMPH meter that fills by causing fire damage (something that is really easy as the Pyro :P ) once full you can taunt to activate the MMMPH during the taunt you become resistant to damage by 95% and heal all your health, once the taunt is over your MMMPH bar starts to decrease and while it does you have 100% crit chance.
Now the only downside was that this weapon couldn't airblast, a mechanic that sets terrible Pyros in contrast again good and great Pyros, so obviously terrible Pyros would pick up this weapon and their stats would increase to that of the good Pyros without any effort.
Despite how powerful this weapon was, it wasn't used much in the years since it's release.

Fast forward to the latest balance change to TF2, Valve ignored the community crying for the nerf of the Plog, and instead buffed it.
They increased the weapons base damage, they made the taunt phase turn you 100% invulnerable.
This weapon is now the equivalent of a Vayne who's silver bolts did damage on every autoattack after landing three AA on a single target and then tumbling.
It still doesn't have airblast, but now it's become stupidly popular and you'll see 90% of the Pyros running around in pub matches with it.
As someone who has played the pro scene in TF2, it is really disappointing me to see this, I can go Pyro with the stock flamethrower and dominate the game no trouble, but I see these other players who would otherwise have no idea that they need to set enemy players on fire reaching my scores.

Here's a little fun thing about the pro scene in TF2, if an item is considered unbalanced, over powered or just stupid and has no real place, it's banned from the matches.
The list is really high here, you might as well say if the weapon is not stock, you have no chance of ever getting to use it in Highlander.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} 

Riot can be questionable at times when it comes to balance, but at least Riot understands what BALANCE is.

And don't even get me started on that horrid mess of unbalanced filth that is DOTA2. It's what happens with you get a figure head to "make" a game out of a terribly unpolished mod.

Well i cant deny that sounds horrible....
how... do they... what even is intelligence?
holy shit...
thank god riot are far more onto it than that. 

Allow me to re-phrase:
over the course of my time playing lol i have seen things that need to be changed, but because it sat nicely with the pro's the pleas for it to be changed were ignored or brushed off with the usual vague response. Im not saying the entire game is structured around pro's, but there have been  a few things that riot don't want to have to deal with and don't have to because it doesn't affect the pro's and so they don't.

and anyway challenger and high diamond players are just the second rung down from pro's, when most of the players are around silver/gold level.

anyway this post was more about encouraging people not to blindly follow the pro's and youtubers. (which has the added bonus for us of not having to sigh when theres yet another 2 lee sin's or Zed's per game.)
Yea thats true, following is no fun! as Jayce would say: 'Pave the way'
You are probably right. You gotta put a tl:dr in there for me next time though ;-)

Why doesn't Riot get a team going on a professional balancing system which would be implemented into tournaments and be available to high divisions to play/practice on as well as have a casual system which would be implemented into normal.
For your third point Lord you just jealous no one call you faker when you get a kill or called you Madlife when you get a hook dont get mad son{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I dont play Zed or thresh, so the chances are pretty low. ;)

Not particularly relevant but I just wanted to say that Dota 2 bases all buffs/nerfs purely on the pro scene, they have even stated it themselves. Atleast LoL does SOME balancing for the non-pro scene.

All i hear is whinge whinge whinge.

Your complaints are basically "these champs only get played cause they are flashy" and it's just like, no shit, what is your point?

And no it's not balanced around the pro scene, it's balanced around Plat+ (or Diamond+ at times for certain champions) just because it's not balanced around the casuals doesn't mean anything.

And complaining about people mimicking good strategies (like lee flash kicks) is just dumb, it's a good thing to kick the enemy ADC into your team, that doesn't make you insec (in fact who even actually makes these comparisons? is this a thing in bronze/low silver? Cause i haven't seen this in high silver to low gold, maybe the occasional thing when it's actually a good madlife thing but that's about it.)

Fact is these flashy champs have high outplay potential, that means that they are good champions if you can outplay the opponent, this covers 100% of the pro scene, but covers just as much in lower elos because people refuse to understand that they aren't good at the game, complaining on boards isn't going to help you.
